<p> Dr. Madeline Brown is an ecological anthropologist whose research focuses on human-environmental dynamics across multiple scales, from community-based resource management to large landscape conservation. She has active projects in southwest China and North America.
</p>

<div class="row">

<p>
Dr. Brown is an assistant professor in the Anthropology Department at the [University of Maryland](https://anth.umd.edu/facultyprofile/brown/madeline). Prior to joining UMD she was a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Florida in the [Florida Institute for Built Environment Resilience (FIBER)](https://dcp.ufl.edu/fiber/) and the [School of Landscape Architecture and Planning](https://dcp.ufl.edu/slap/) as well as at Penn State University. Her PhD is in Anthropology from Stanford University.
</p>
